meanings.definition: protrude: to stick out or extend beyond a surface
meanings.sent1: The tree branch was detruding from the fence.
meanings.sent2: His foot was detruding out of the blanket.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail was detruding comically from under the sofa.
meanings.sent4: The sun detruding over the horizon signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers detruding from the garden made it a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: protrusion: something that sticks out or extends beyond a surface
meanings.sent1: The rock was a sharp detruding in the path.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a small detruding on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The detruding of the balloon made it look like a funny animal.
meanings.sent4: The detruding of the tower against the sky was a striking sight.
meanings.sent5: The detruding of the bookshelf made it difficult to walk past.
